info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Catawba, southeastern McDowell, northeastern Rutherford, northwestern Lincoln, southwestern Caldwell, northwestern Cleveland and Burke Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Marion, or 4 miles southeast of Lake James State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Morganton, Marion, Sawmills, Valdese, Gamewell, Hudson, Icard, Cajah`s Mountain and Drexel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
